348.article_body: North Korea has passed a law allowing it to carry out a preemptive nuclear attack to protect itself. With the new law, "the status of our country as a nuclear weapons state has become irreversible", leader Kim Jong-un said. Kim in July said his country was "ready to mobilise" its nuclear capability in any war with US and South Korea.

349.title: Akshay had jumped to save person who put his feet on open electric cable: Vipul
349.article_body: Filmmaker Vipul Shah said that actor Akshay Kumar had once, without thinking of his own safety, jumped to save a person who had put his feet on an open electric cable. "There was a risk of being electrocuted, but he just pulled the person out of the situation," he said, adding that Akshay looks after his crew.

350.title: Whether I'll become Congress Prez or not will be clear after party polls: Rahul
350.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi during a media conference amid the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' on Friday said that whether he will become the party President or not will become clear when the party conducts the election. He added that he has made his decision about if he will contest the party's election or not and that there is "no confusion".

351.title: Hyd's 21-kg Balapur laddu auctioned for ₹24.6 lakh during Ganesh Chaturthi
351.article_body: The 21-kg famous laddu of Balapur in Hyderabad was auctioned for ₹24.6 lakh on Friday morning during the Ganesh Chaturthi festivities in Telangana. The auction was won by Vengeti Laxma Reddy of VLR builders. Reports said that this was the 29th year of holding an auction of the laddu. In 1994, the laddu was reportedly auctioned for ₹450.

352.title: 'The Crown' is a love letter to Queen Elizabeth II: Show's writer
352.article_body: 'The Crown' writer Peter Morgan has stated that the Emmy-winning drama series is a "love letter" to Queen Elizabeth II. The Queen, who was Britain's longest-serving monarch, passed away on Thursday at the age of 96. Peter further said, "I've nothing to add for now, just silence and respect. I expect we will stop filming out of respect too."

353.title: Los Angeles declares September 17 as 'Squid Game' Day
353.article_body: Los Angeles has officially designated September 17 as 'Squid Game' Day to commemorate the influence of the Korean drama series on American pop culture. The resolution passed by the city council states the series made history "by becoming the first Korean and first foreign language series to be nominated at the Screen Actors Guild Awards [and] bringing home three wins".

354.title: PMC to construct another bridge on Mutha river at a cost of ₹45 cr
354.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will construct one more bridge on the Mutha river to connect the Sinhagad Road to Karvenagar as proposed in the Development Plan of the city, a PMC official said. The project, which is estimated to cost ₹45 crore, will divert a lot of traffic from the main Sinhagad Road, the official added.

355.title: Improve hospitals for treatment of burn victims: NCW asks J'khand govt
355.article_body: The National Commission for Women (NCW) has directed the Jharkhand government to "improve hospital infrastructure" for the treatment of burn victims. This comes after a fact-finding committee visited the state to investigate a 15-year-old girl's death who was set ablaze by her stalker. The committee found two hospitals, where the victim was taken for treatment, to be lacking basic infrastructure.

356.title: I got wickets wherever I was bowling: Bhuvneshwar Kumar on his 5/4
356.article_body: Having recorded his career-best figures of 4-1-4-5 in the Asia Cup match against Afghanistan, India pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar said he was able to pick wickets "wherever" he bowled. "It was my day...The white-ball [usually] doesn't swing much but it...swung a lot today," added Bhuvneshwar. Bhuvneshwar broke the record for picking the most wickets for India in T20Is, overtaking Yuzvendra Chahal.

357.title: IIT Delhi launches app to enable city people to report flooding in real time
357.article_body: IIT Delhi has launched a mobile application to enable the residents of the national capital to report flooding in real time. Reports said that this will help researchers in developing an early warning system to predict urban floods. The app, called IITD Aab Prahari, has been developed as part of the Civil Engineering Department's Water Security Hub project.

358.title: India declares 1-day state mourning on Sept 11 over Queen Elizabeth II's demise
358.article_body: The Centre on Friday announced that one-day state mourning will be observed throughout India on September 11 "as a mark of respect on the passing away of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland". On Sunday, the Tricolour will be flown at half mast on all buildings where the National Flag is flown regularly.

359.title: Ananya is very dear to me & will always remain so: Ishaan on breakup
359.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter spoke about his breakup with actress Ananya Panday during his appearance on celebrity talk show 'Koffee with Karan'. He said, "She is one of the most wonderful people I have known...Anyone who has met her would say this...And all pulpy questions aside, she is someone who is very dear to me and will always remain so."

360.title: Delhi Police conducts raids in 22 cities, busts cyber fraud gang; 65 held
360.article_body: Delhi Police busted a cyber fraud gang and arrested 65 people who allegedly cheated people on the pretext of updating the BSES electricity bill. The arrests were made after the police conducted raids in 22 cities across the country over 10 days. The police said that NCRP had received over 200 complaints and over 500 instances of cheating were noticed.

361.title: Election petitions should ideally be disposed of in 6 months: K'taka HC
361.article_body: Election petitions should ideally be disposed of within six months, Karnataka High Court has said. The court was hearing a petition filed in 2018 by Muniraju Gowda, who as the BJP candidate, lost the Assembly elections to the then Congress candidate Munirathna Naidu, who is now a minister in the BJP government. Gowda had filed the petition seeking Naidu's disqualification.

362.title: Allu Arjun backs out of 'Icon' over story, upcoming lineups: Report
362.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun, who was expected to begin shooting for Venu Sriram's 'Icon', has backed out of the film due to the story and his upcoming lineups, reported Pinkvilla. This was going to be his first collaboration with Sriram. The report added Sriram has pitched a script to actor Ram Pothineni but there is no confirmation if it is 'Icon'.

363.title: US woman throws dead racoon at abortion clinic, attacks police; held
363.article_body: A US woman has been arrested for allegedly attacking police officers after throwing a dead racoon at an Ohio abortion clinic. The woman also allegedly threw eggs at volunteer escorts, who shielded themselves with umbrellas. Attacks against abortion clinic workers and volunteers have reportedly risen following US Supreme Court's decision in June to overturn a ruling which legalised abortion.

364.title: SC grants bail to Kerala journalist Kappan arrested by UP govt in 2020 under UAPA
364.article_body: Supreme Court has granted bail to Kerala journalist Siddique Kappan who was arrested by UP government under the Unlawful Activities Prevention Act (UAPA). Kappan was arrested in 2020 while he was on his way to Hathras where a Dalit woman had died after allegedly being gang-raped. Kappan will be released after being produced before the trial court in three days.

365.title: You are my most favourite co-star: Kareena on Akshay's birthday
365.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor took to Instagram Stories on Friday to share a picture with actor Akshay Kumar on his birthday. She wrote alongside the picture, "Happy Birthday Akshay. You are and always will be my most favourite co-star ('cause I get to pack up at 3 pm)." They starred together in 'Ajnabee', 'Aitraaz', 'Kambakkht Ishq' and 'Good Newwz' among others.

366.title: Rahul Gandhi drinks coconut water during Bharat Jodo Yatra, video surfaces
366.article_body: A video of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi drinking coconut water during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' has surfaced online. In the video, a man can be seen giving coconut water to Gandhi, following which, he and Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel can be seen having it. Meanwhile, a picture of Congress leader KC Venugopal resting on a bench has also surfaced online.

367.title: Indian-American leader called 'fu***** c***', told to 'go back' in audio shared by her
367.article_body: Indian-American Congresswoman Pramila Jayapal has shared an audio compilation of the abusive threat calls received by her and wrote, "We cannot accept violence as our new norm." In the audio, a man can be heard saying, "You stupid fu***** c***. Get ready for turmoil." "Why don't you guys go back to where you fu***** came from," said another man.

368.title: Kohinoor Crown to go to King Charles' wife Camilla: Report
368.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II, who passed away at the age of 96, had announced that Prince Charles' wife Camilla would become Queen Consort when he accedes to the throne. When this happens, Camilla will receive Queen Mother's famous Kohinoor crown, according to a Daily Mail report. The last Queen Consort was Queen Elizabeth II's mother, who became known as Queen Mother.

369.title: People taking me seriously as actor after 'JugJugg Jeeyo': Maniesh Paul
369.article_body: Actor Maniesh Paul stated in an interview that people have started taking him seriously as an actor after 'JugJugg Jeeyo'. He added that earlier people thought he will only do hosting. "A lot of films are released but people don't necessarily watch them. They came to watch this film and they liked my work so I am thrilled," he said.

370.title: Salman Khan has taught me to keep moving ahead: Shehnaaz Gill
370.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill stated in an interview that she has learnt to keep moving ahead from actor Salman Khan, adding that he motivates her a lot. "He has told me that I can go really far in life if I work hard," the actress added. She will make her Bollywood debut in Salman's 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan'.

371.title: Facilities at campsites basic; BJP trying to 'defame' yatra: Congress
371.article_body: Congress on Friday said its 'Bharat Yatris' were staying in containers which have very "basic and minimal" facilities. The party claimed that BJP was trying to "defame" the yatra by spreading falsehoods about the facilities at its campsites. "This is not like...Rath Yatra. It's not a Toyota Yatra or an Innova Yatra. Ours is...Padyatra," Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said.

372.title: Net inflows to equity mutual funds fall to 10-month low of ₹5,942 cr in Aug
372.article_body: Net inflows to equity-oriented mutual funds fell to a 10-month low of ₹5,942 crore in August as against ₹8,882.6 crore in the previous month, the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) data showed. The data also showed that the total debt scheme clocked ₹49,164 crore worth of inflows in August, while hybrid funds clocked an outflow of ₹6,600 crore.

373.title: Naughty boys of Koffee club should focus on films: Vivek Agnihotri
373.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri on Thursday indirectly reacted to an old video of him saying he eats beef. He wrote on Twitter, "I think the naughty boys of Koffee club should ask their SM agencies and PR firms to focus on their film rather than fighting the battle with me. I'm not the kind whom you can break with free hampers."

374.title: You've rested enough: Gambhir on Rohit being rested vs Afghanistan
374.article_body: Talking about Rohit Sharma being rested for the match against Afghanistan, Gautam Gambhir said, "You cannot be resting, you've...rested enough." "Rohit should...[play] every game from here on looking at the T20 World Cup," added Gambhir. Sharing his opinion on Virat Kohli scoring his first international hundred after nearly three years, Gambhir stated, "[Nobody] would've survived...this long."

375.title: Dogs around MP zoo given anti-rabies vaccine before arrival of cheetahs
375.article_body: Ahead of the arrival of cheetahs in Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park, over 1,000 dogs around the zoo have been administered the anti-rabies vaccine, an official said. The cheetahs, that are from Africa, will arrive at the zoo as part of India's project to reintroduce the animal. This was done to protect the cheetahs from rabies, the official added.

376.title: 102-yr-old man declared 'dead' dresses up as groom to prove he's alive in Haryana
376.article_body: A 102-year-old man staged a protest and dressed up like a groom to prove he's alive, claiming that his pension was stopped earlier this year on the ground that he was dead. Duli Chand undertook a procession to hand over a memorandum to officials, urging them to restore his pension. He also held a 'Your uncle is still alive' board.

377.title: Arunachal Assembly adopts Transplantation of Human Organ Act
377.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh Assembly on Thursday unanimously adopted the Transplantation of Human Organ Act, 1994 (Amendment Act 2011). "Adoption of this Act will be our first step towards creating suitable infrastructure for implementation, capacity building of hospital staff and doctors, advocacy for promoting deceased organ and tissue donation," Arunachal Health Minister Alo Libang said.

378.title: Winter is going to be hard on the battlefield in Ukraine: NATO chief
378.article_body: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg warned that "winter is going to be hard on the battlefield in Ukraine" as "there's no sign of Russia giving up its goal of taking control of Ukraine". Stoltenberg said Ukraine is in urgent need of winter essentials as "the size of...Ukrainian army is now roughly three times as big as what it was last winter".

379.title: 4 trekkers from West Bengal missing in Kullu since Wednesday
379.article_body: Four trekkers from West Bengal have gone missing in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district since Wednesday, said officials on Friday. They were trekking to Mount Ali Ratni Tibba. A cook and two others, who were part of the expedition, informed authorities about the missing men after returning to Wachem near Malana village, according to the State Disaster Management Authority (SDMA).

380.title: Kolkata-based Wow! Momo raises ₹125 cr from OAKS Asset Management
380.article_body: Kolkata-headquartered Wow! Momo raised around ₹125 crore from OAKS Asset Management at a valuation of ₹2,125 crore in its Series D round of funding. The company is set to raise another ₹100 crore from another venture capital fund in the next quarter, it said. Backed by Tiger Global, Wow! Momo was founded by Binod Homagai and Sagar Daryani in 2008.

381.title: PNC Infratech stock rises 3% after firm bags ₹1,458-cr NHAI project
381.article_body: After PNC Infratech said that it had signed an agreement with the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) for a ₹1,458-crore project, its stock rose by nearly 3% to ₹294.95 apiece on BSE on Friday. PNC said it will work on the Sonauli-Gorakhpur section of NH-29E in Uttar Pradesh. At 11:45 am, its shares were trading at ₹294.05 on BSE.

382.title: Pic of 'bored' 4-year-old Charles at his mother Elizabeth II's coronation resurfaces
382.article_body: A picture showing 4-year-old Charles at Elizabeth II's coronation has resurfaced as he becomes the King after the demise of his mother. Commenting on the picture which was shared by the Royal Collection Trust on Instagram in 2019, a user wrote, "The kid's bored." In the picture, Charles is standing between his grandmother, and aunt Princess Margaret.

383.title: Gujarat Congress calls for bandh over jobs, inflation on Saturday
383.article_body: Gujarat Congress has called for a bandh in the state over inflation and unemployment on Saturday. The party appealed to traders and businesses to keep their shops closed from 8 am to 12 noon. Party's state chief Jagdish Thakor claimed that there are over 4.5 lakh registered unemployed youths in the state, while lakhs of government posts remain vacant.

384.title: Delhi govt begins prep for spraying decomposer to curb stubble burning
384.article_body: The Delhi government has started preparing to spray bio-decomposer on farmland to prevent stubble burning, said Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai. The decomposer will be sprayed free of cost on all basmati and non-basmati paddy fields in the city, Rai added. Last year, the government received applications for spraying the decomposer on around 4,300 acres of paddy fields in Delhi.

385.title: Tata Group in talks with Taiwanese supplier for JV to assemble iPhones in India: Report
385.article_body: Tata Group is in talks with Taiwanese supplier Wistron to establish a joint venture to assemble Apple's iPhones in India, Bloomberg reported. Apple began iPhone assembly in India in 2017 via Wistron and later with Foxconn. The plan could result in Tata Group buying equity in Wistron's India operations or two companies building a new assembly plant, the report added.

386.title: King Charles to now travel without passport, drive without licence, have 2 birthdays
386.article_body: UK's new king Charles III can travel without a passport and drive without a licence. As his birthday is on November 14, it's likely he'll have an 'official birthday' in a warmer month. He would also own all unmarked mute swans in England. He can grant Royal Warrants to companies/tradespeople. Burberry, Cadbury, Jaguar Cars are among companies with Royal Warrants.

387.title: Andhra Pradesh CM orders action against money lending apps after couple's suicide
387.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy has ordered for stringent action to be taken against online money lending apps for harassment of users. This comes after a city couple died by suicide following harassment by loan application agents. The Chief Minister also directed East Godavari district collector to provide financial assistance of ₹5 lakh each to victims' children.

388.title: Woman develops complications after family planning operation in Hyd, dies
388.article_body: A woman died after allegedly developing complications after undergoing a family planning operation in Hyderabad. Reports said that the woman passed away while undergoing treatment. However, reports added that the exact reason for the woman's death is not yet known and that the officials from the hospital have not issued any statement as of now.

389.title: Van falls into 120-ft-deep well in TN; 3 college students killed
389.article_body: Three college students were killed after a van they were travelling in plunged into a 120-foot-deep well in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore on Friday, police said. According to the police, the well had over 80 feet of water and the college students drowned. The van's driver, who sustained injuries, was driving the vehicle in a rash and negligent manner, police added.

390.title: 25-year-old homeless woman gangraped by 3 near Gorakhpur station
390.article_body: A 25-year-old homeless woman was allegedly kidnapped and gangraped by three youths near Gorakhpur railway station in Uttar Pradesh, police said on Thursday. The victim was admitted to BRD Medical College after she reported the incident to the police, said SP (Railway) Awdhesh Singh. The suspects beat her and fled when she tried to raise an alarm, he added.

391.title: Bihar man jailed for wife's murder, police find her alive at dad's Nepal home
391.article_body: The wife of a man who was allegedly sent to jail for her murder in Bihar, was found alive and well at her maternal home in Nepal. Reports said that the woman's parents had accused her husband and her in-laws of burning their daughter alive. The police had launched an investigation even though the woman's husband had been jailed.

392.title: Had promising talks with Apple about Starlink: Musk on iPhone 14 SOS feature
392.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk on Thursday said the company had "promising conversations" with Apple regarding Starlink connectivity for iPhone 14's new satellite-powered SOS feature. "For sure, closing link from space to phone will work best if phone software and hardware adapt to space-based signals vs Starlink purely emulating cell tower," he added. Apple chose Globalstar's services to power the feature.

393.title: Pune's PCMC receives 69,032 applications for 386 permanent posts
393.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has received 69,032 job applications for 386 permanent posts. "The last date for applying is till 6 pm September 8," an official earlier said. Notably, recruitment for the posts is being carried out after nearly seven years. As many as 22,000 have applied for the 213 clerical posts and 21,000 for junior engineers posts.

394.title: Over 8,000 policemen to patrol Pune roads for Ganesh idol immersions today
394.article_body: More than 8,000 policemen will be patrolling Pune streets today for Ganesh idol immersions on the occasion of Anant Chaturdashi, an official said. Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta said CCTVs had been installed at various spots in the city. "Nearly 3,000 registered Ganesh pandals will carry out immersions. They will be allowed to play music only till midnight," he added.

395.title: 5 killed, 11 injured after jeep collides with truck in Rajasthan
395.article_body: Five people, including a child, died and 11 others were injured after the jeep they were travelling in collided with a truck in Rajasthan's Nagaur district on Thursday night. According to Circle Officer Jayal Rameshwar Lal, the accident occurred when the jeep was going to Sikar from Ramdevra temple in Jaisalmer. All passengers were residents of Ringas, Lal added.

396.title: OTT has horrible culture, takes months to get back: Prakash Jha
396.article_body: Filmmaker Prakash Jha has stated that OTT platforms have a horrible culture, adding that they take months to get back. "They say your film is a dry film, it is artsy and takes months to get back, sometimes not with positive answers," he added. The filmmaker further said the audience has a choice now and rejects films that aren't good.

397.title: All rumours are fake: Charmme on reports of Vijay's 'Jana...' being shelved
397.article_body: Actress-producer Charmme Kaur has addressed the reports of Vijay Deverakonda's 'Jana Gana Mana' being shelved after the box office failure of 'Liger'. She wrote on Twitter, "Rumours rumours rumours! All rumours are fake! Just focusing on the progress of Puri Connects. Meanwhile, RIP rumours!!" 'Jana Gana Mana' will feature Vijay as an army officer and co-stars Pooja Hegde.

398.title: Pic of elderly fan bowing down to Kohli moments after his 71st int'l hundred goes viral
398.article_body: A picture of an elderly fan bowing down to Virat Kohli from the stands just moments after his 71st international hundred has gone viral on social media. "Only Virat Kohli can make a man more than twice his age bow down to him," a fan tweeted. "This pic goes hard and deep!" wrote another. Kohli slammed 122*(61) against Afghanistan.

399.title: Congress fired missiles, I only retaliated with 303 rifle: Azad
399.article_body: Ghulam Nabi Azad, who recently resigned from the Congress, has criticised the party saying that they "fired missiles" on him but he only retaliated with a "303 rifle" and they were destroyed. "What would have happened had I used a ballistic missile?" he added. Earlier, Azad had said that he will launch a new party soon.

400.title: Inquiry ordered: Shinde on 'beautification' of terrorist Yakub's grave
400.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Thursday said that an inquiry has been ordered over the alleged beautification of terrorist Yakub Memon's grave. "Strict action will be taken against...persons responsible," he added. Earlier, BJP claimed that the previous state government under former CM Uddhav Thackeray was responsible. Memon was convicted in the 1993 Mumbai blasts case and was hanged in 2015.

401.title: BMC to renovate Mumbai's iconic Worli Fort, black basalt stone bought
401.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will be giving the iconic Worli Fort a makeover, reports said. The civic body has also purchased black basalt stone for the renovation process. "We have just started work on the project...We will also illuminate it at night so that it becomes visible from the sea link," an official said.
